value.title: The difference between, ID, access, refresh, and session tokens? | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between identity, access, refresh, and session tokens.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/access-tokens?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-AzureIdent

value.title: What are App Application Permissions vs Delegated Permissions? | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains how Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) applications and users interact with different parts of the permissions system. value.title: What is Azure Sentinel and why you should care | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn what Azure Sentinel is and how to use it. Azure Sentinel provides a threat detection and mitigation service that helps you to detect incident and threats when they happen and helps you to solve them as effectively as possible.    For more tips and

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 1: Describe core Azure concepts
value.excerpt: This learning path provides you with an introduction to the basics of Azure cloud computing and Azure architecture.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Discuss Azure fundamental concepts
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different types and categories of cloud computing.

topItems.title: Describe core Azure architectural components
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure Subscriptions, Management Groups, Resource Groups, Resource Manager, Azure Regions, and Availability zones.

value.title: Introduction to machine learning with Python and Azure Notebooks
value.excerpt: Python has become a dominant language for doing data analysis with machine learning. Learn how to leverage Python and associated libraries in Jupyter Notebooks run on Azure Notebooks to predict patterns and identify trends.

topItems.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks
topItems.excerpt: Create an Azure Notebook and use three popular Python libraries to analyze climate data collected by NASA, then share it.

images.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

topItems.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python
topItems.excerpt: Import airline arrival data into a Jupyter notebook and use Pandas to clean it. Then, build a machine learning model with Scikit-Learn and use Matplotlib to visualize output.

images.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python

topItems.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras
topItems.excerpt: Keras is a high-level neural networks API, written in Python, that runs on top of other deep learning tools such as TensorFlow. This module uses Keras to build a neural network that scores text, such as user reviews for sentiment.

images.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras
Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring it's underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about virtualization and how it's used in the cloud
Know what VMs and containers are
Understand what scale, load, and common load patterns are
Know what autoscaling is and be familiar with autoscaling techniques
Learn how to automate cloud resource management with scripts
Understand the concept of infrastructure-as-code

In Partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

value.title: Automate GitHub by using GitHub Script
value.excerpt: Learn to interact with the GitHub API from GitHub Actions by using GitHub Script.

value.title: Describe core Azure architectural components
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure Subscriptions, Management Groups, Resource Groups, Resource Manager, Azure Regions, and Availability zones.

value.title: Build Serverless APIs with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to build a Serverless API using Azure Functions. You'll connect that API to Azure Cosmos DB, deploy the API to Azure and finish with a fully functional web application.

value.title: Automate cloud resource management

value.title: Communicate effectively on GitHub by using Markdown
value.excerpt: Learn to use Markdown to communicate with brevity, clarity, and expression.

value.title: Copy and move blobs from one container or storage account to another from the command line and in code
value.excerpt: Learn how to utilize .NET Storage Client library, AzCopy, and Azure CLI utilities to copy and move blobs between contains and storage accounts both synchronously and asynchronously.
